channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: Am I the only one hoping for a surprise announcement of Adar Shlishi tomorrow?
@scalzi Comforting that the books my son devoured are reasonably accurate. Somewhat disturbing that you live near a nuclear power plant, albeit one allegedly decommissioned.
@dzkalman Hoping this is part of a plan to release Wingspan DLC.
Really great example of a close read of NYT “journalism.” https://t.co/X4oJhMCE5N
@NeilLewisJr @kkaplan Speaking of old laws still on the books….
@Hex_Giraffe @analuciaraujo_ @nhannahjones @slavevoyages Arguably, certain New Jersey counties should be colored in pale yellow. https://t.co/ECO0TScEQG

@prof_dainy You know, you could make a great YA adventure novel out of an exploration of America as understood third-hand by the Chofetz Chaim.
@prof_dainy Haven't seen it inside, but apparently he thought it was a far wilder hellhole than it actually was.
@AkivaMCohen Clearly the chain of deniability was put in place to launder this fraud. As I’m sure e-mails provided for discovery will prove, right?

@datadivajf @swordsjew She has great stuff on the history of the Seder, based on the Tosefta. Which I should reread.
@datadivajf @swordsjew Looks like Hillel Sandwich once had a Wikipedia entry, but it was deleted. I know the feeling. https://t.co/5meX1yQgzl

@swordsjew Seems like the absence of the Hillel Sandwich is pretty clear antisemitism.
@swordsjew Looks like I have more than a year to add that entry and maintain it through the Wikipedia editorial process.

@AkivaMCohen Serious question (which relates to a suit against @OrthodoxUnion I have written about): What is the general outcome of suits filed against John Doe defendants? Are the real names substituted at the conclusion of discovery and depositions? https://t.co/JugjcSS6Ft
@BergYeshivaView They’ll still have campuses in New York, LA, and Jerusalem. This is more about the decline of flyover country as a destination for unmarried young people.
@EvelKneidel Circled lazily, occasionally breaking to dive bomb…
@trekonomics https://t.co/Uey8l9G8Au
@EladNehorai As long as they paid fealty to white patriarchal values, for sure.

@ManischewitzCo I saw! So sad that the rest of the world keeps going after we go to press.
@ManischewitzCo On the other hand, this may be new material for next week....

In which I bring the social media fun of @ManischewitzCo to the readers of print media. https://t.co/bvSvTbhhuo
https://t.co/0XNktWad8L

@trekonomics Well, there are worse ways for New Jersey and New York to resolve their current dispute over their joint Waterfront Commission. https://t.co/P4H91m8RaR
@trekonomics Though in some ways, those were more innocent times: “The last fight broke out in 1765, when the Jerseyans attempted to capture the leaders of the New York faction. Because the fight took place on the Sabbath, neither side used weapons.”
@segalmr @JanNWolfe Hoping Marc Elias will hold out for discovery.
@Historycourses Jefferson’s similar desire led to the Library of Congress.

Good thread. But worth adding that much conservative rhetoric is premised on erasing the multiplicity of minority communities. https://t.co/G78J6nwNJp
We see that very much when the topic of antisemitism comes up.

I think I already vaguetweeted an upcoming @BenYehudaPress project I'm very excited about but cannot yet announce, in part because the contract has not yet been signed. I just got off the phone with the author and am even more excited.
@BabblingBrookeA True of children, too, but that never stopped any parent.
@trekonomics Hard not to suspect that hanging around with Martin Peretz was not good for young Andrew’s soul. And I wonder about Leon’s influence.
